              def execute_castle(to)

              def filter_rook_rights(available, castleable, king_cell)
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            21
            

            

                castleable.each do |rook_cell|
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            40
            

            

                  moves = rook_cell.piece.valid_paths(@game.board, rook_cell)
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            109
            

            

                  move = moves.select { |check_move| check_move.include?(king_cell) }.pop
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            40
            

            

                  king_side = rook_cell.name > 'e'
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            40
            

            

                  steps = move ? move.valid.length : 0
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            40
            

            

                  clear = king_side ? steps == 2 : steps == 3
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            40
            

            

                  delete = king_side ? 'K' : 'Q'
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            40
            

            

                  delete = king_side ? 'k' : 'q' if king_cell.piece.black?
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            40
            

            

                  available.delete!(delete) unless clear
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            21

      126.

              def update_game_stats(piece, destination)

                update_active(piece)

              def king_moves_helper(psuedo, origin, danger_zone, no_go_zone)
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            56
            

            

                to_test = (danger_zone - no_go_zone) & psuedo

    110. 
            56

            56

    112. 
            56

              def pawn_moves_helper(psuedo, cell)

              def move_legal?(game_to_copy, king_to_check, origin, destination)

    144. 
            43

            43

            43
            

            

                game.move_piece(copy_origin, copy_destination)

      150.

              def passant_capture(piece)

    168. 
            338

            338

      170.

            338

      171.

              def prompt_pick_move(cell, eligible)

            3
            

            

                loop do

            4

    132. 
            4
            

            

                  input = gets.chomp.downcase
          
      133.

            4

              def prompt_pawn_promotion(cell)
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                puts "Congratulations! A #{cell.piece.color == :white ? 'white' : 'black'} pawn has made it to promotion."
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                puts 'You can select a (q)ueen, a k(n)ight, (r)ook or (b)ishop.'
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                loop do
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                  print 'Enter the promotion you would like: '
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                  input = gets.chomp.downcase
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                  puts 'Invalid input, try again.' unless %w[q n r b].include?(input)
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                  next unless %w[q n r b].include?(input)
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

            
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                  fen = @game.active == :white ? input.upcase : input.downcase

    152.

      153.

              def prompt_save
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                loop do
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                  puts "You can load games via fen.txt in the save directory. You can also 'exit'."
          
      170.

                  print 'Would you like to load a game? (y/n) '
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                  input = gets.chomp.downcase
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                  abort('Thanks for playing!') if input == 'exit'
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

                  puts 'Invalid input, try asgain.' unless %w[y n].include?(input)
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                  next unless %w[y n].include?(input)
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

            
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

                  return (input == 'y' ? 'load' : 'new')

              def colorize_cell_bg(text, white)
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            316
            

            

                white ? "\e[100m#{text}\e[0m" : "\e[0m#{text}\e[0m"

    194.

              def colorize_cell_bg_capture(text)
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            4
            

            

                "\e[41m#{text}\e[0m"
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            
            

            

              end

            require_relative '../lib/cell'

            describe Cell do
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            1
            

            

              context 'on empty initialize' do
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            5
            

            

                subject(:cell) { described_class.new }
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10.

    11. 
            1
            

            

                it 'defaults to empty' do

    12. 
            1
            

            

                  expect(cell.empty?).to be true
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14.

    15. 
            1
            

            

                it 'has no name' do

            1

                end

    18.

            1

    20. 
            1
            

            

                  expect(cell.full?).to be false
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                end

            1

                  expect(cell_white_n.hostile?(King.new('K'))).to be false

                end

            1
            

            

                it 'correctly identifies whether another piece is friendly' do

    52. 
            1
            

            

                  expect(cell_white_n.friendly?(King.new('K'))).to be true
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            1
            

            

                  expect(cell_white_n.friendly?(Rook.new('r'))).to be false
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      57.

                    expect(board.data[4][4].piece).to be_a(Pawn).and be_white

    243. 
            1
            

            

                  it 'sends the right messages to itself' do

            1

            1
            

            

                  it 'move 1: correctly identifies a passant move' do

            1

            4

                  end
          
      253.

            1
            

            

                  it 'move 2: correctly executes passant if taken' do
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            1
            

            

                    passant.set_board_state('k7/7p/8/8/6pP/8/8/K7 b - h3 0 1')
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            4
            

            

                    expect { passant.move_piece('g4', 'h3') }.to change { passant.passant }.from('h3').to('-')
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            1
            

            

                    expect(passant.cell('h4')).to be_empty
          
      258.

            8

      510.

                  # This test is identical to the source except there are no castle rights,  mostly because I haven't tackled castling yet.
          
      511. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    511. 
            1
            

            

                  game.set_board_state('r3k2r/p1ppqpb1/bn2pnp1/3PN3/1p2P3/2N2Q1p/PPPBBPPP/R3K2R w - - 0 1')
          
      512. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    512. 
            1
            

            

                  moves = 0
          
      513. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    513. 
            1
            

            

                  game.board.data.each do |rank|
          
      514. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    514. 
            8
            

            

                    rank.each do |cell|
          
      515. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    515. 
            64
            

            

                      next if cell.empty? || cell.piece.black?
          
      516. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    516. 
            
            

            

            
          
      517. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    517. 
            16
            

            

                      legal = legal_moves_test.legal_moves(cell)
          
      518. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    518. 
            
            

            

                      # puts "moves from #{cell.to_fen}#{cell}: #{legal}"
          
      519. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    519. 
            16
            

            

                      moves += legal.length
          
      520. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    520. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      521. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    521. 
            
            

            

                  end

    522. 
            1

      610. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    610. 
            
            

            

            
          
      611. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    611. 
            14
            

            

                        legal = legal_moves_test.legal_moves(cell)
          
      612. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    612. 
            14
            

            

                        moves += legal.length
          
      613. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    613. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      614. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    614. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      615. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    615. 
            
            

            

            
          
      616. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    616. 
            1
            

            

                    expect(moves).to eq(41)
          
      617. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    617. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      618. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    618. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      619. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    619. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      620. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    620. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      621.

            1

                    it 'returns the string if a move is valid' do
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            1
            

            

                      cell = chess.cell('f3')
          
      149.

            1
            

            

                      valid_moves = chess.move_manager.legal_moves(cell)
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            1
            

            

                      input = 'g5'

      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            1
            

            

                      expect(ui).to receive(:print).once
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            1
            

            

                      expect(ui.prompt_pick_move(cell, valid_moves)).to eq('g5')
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

            
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            1
            

            

                    it 'reprompts if a move is not valid' do
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            1
            

            

                      cell = chess.cell('f3')
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            1
            

            

                      valid_moves = chess.move_manager.legal_moves(cell)
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            1
            

            

                      input = 'g5'
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            1
            

            

                      invalid_input = 'e2'
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            1
            

            

                      allow(ui).to receive(:gets).and_return(invalid_input, input)
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            1
            

            

                      expect(ui).to receive(:puts).twice
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            1
            

            

                      expect(ui).to receive(:print).twice
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            1
            

            

                      expect(ui.prompt_pick_move(cell, valid_moves)).to eq('g5')
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      171.
